es.title: Press de banca con barra
es.lead: Exercise for chest, triceps and front deltoids
firstPosition: Lying on the bench, your feet flat on the floor. Grasp the bar with a grip wider than shoulder width. Your forearms should be perpendicular to the floor.
Unhook the bar and slowly lower it to the lower part of your chest. As you contract your pectorals, push the load upwards until your arms are almost straight.
During the whole movement:

en.title: Barbell Bench Press
en.lead: Exercise for chest, triceps and front deltoids
firstPosition: Lying on the bench, your feet flat on the floor. Grasp the bar with a grip wider than shoulder width. Your forearms should be perpendicular to the floor.
Unhook the bar and slowly lower it to the lower part of your chest. As you contract your pectorals, push the load upwards until your arms are almost straight.
During the whole movement:

es.title: Press banca inclinado con mancuernas
es.lead: Exercise for chest, triceps and front deltoids
firstPosition: Lying on the sloping bench, your feet flat on the ground, one dumbbell in each hand, pronation grip. Hold the dumbbells at your sides at chest height. Your forearms should be perpendicular to the ground.
While contracting your pectorals, push the load upwards until your arms are almost straight, then return to the initial position.
During the whole movement:

en.title: Incline Dumbbell Bench Press
en.lead: Exercise for chest, triceps and front deltoids
firstPosition: Lying on the sloping bench, your feet flat on the ground, one dumbbell in each hand, pronation grip. Hold the dumbbells at your sides at chest height. Your forearms should be perpendicular to the ground.
While contracting your pectorals, push the load upwards until your arms are almost straight, then return to the initial position.
During the whole movement:

es.title: Aperturas en máquina Peck Deck o Contractora
es.lead: Exercise for chest and front deltoids
firstPosition: Sitting on the "Peck deck" machine with your back pressed against the backrest, your forearms well supported against the padded parts provided for this purpose. Your upper arms should be parallel to the ground and in line with your shoulders.
Tighten your arms as much as possible following the movement of the machine. Tighten your chest at the end of the movement and then slowly return to the initial position.

en.title: Peck Deck
en.lead: Exercise for chest and front deltoids
firstPosition: Sitting on the "Peck deck" machine with your back pressed against the backrest, your forearms well supported against the padded parts provided for this purpose. Your upper arms should be parallel to the ground and in line with your shoulders.
Tighten your arms as much as possible following the movement of the machine. Tighten your chest at the end of the movement and then slowly return to the initial position.

es.title: Cruce de poleas
es.lead: Exercise for chest and front deltoids
firstPosition: Grasp the handles attached to the ends of each rope and stand in the middle between the pulleys. Bend your chest slightly forward and keep your elbows slightly bent.

Slowly tighten your arms in front of your chest in an arc. Keep your elbows slightly bent during the movement. When your hands come together, hold the position for a moment, contracting your chest. Then slowly return to the original position.

en.title: Cable Crossover
en.lead: Exercise for chest and front deltoids
firstPosition: Grasp the handles attached to the ends of each rope and stand in the middle between the pulleys. Bend your chest slightly forward and keep your elbows slightly bent.

Slowly tighten your arms in front of your chest in an arc. Keep your elbows slightly bent during the movement. When your hands come together, hold the position for a moment, contracting your chest. Then slowly return to the original position.

es.title: Press de banca inclinado con barra
es.lead: Exercise for chest, triceps and front deltoids
firstPosition: Lying on the sloping bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grasp the bar with a grip wider than shoulder width. Your forearms should be perpendicular to the ground.
Unhook the bar and slowly lower it to the top of your chest. As you contract your pectorals, push the load upwards until your arms are almost straight.
During the whole movement:

en.title: Incline Barbell Bench Press
en.lead: Exercise for chest, triceps and front deltoids
firstPosition: Lying on the sloping bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grasp the bar with a grip wider than shoulder width. Your forearms should be perpendicular to the ground.
Unhook the bar and slowly lower it to the top of your chest. As you contract your pectorals, push the load upwards until your arms are almost straight.
During the whole movement:

es.title: Press de banca con mancuernas
es.lead: Exercise for chest, triceps and front deltoids
firstPosition: Lying on the bench, your feet flat on the floor, one dumbbell in each hand, pronation grip. Hold the dumbbells at your sides at chest height. Your forearms should be perpendicular to the ground.
By contracting your pectorals, push the load against upwards until your arms are almost extended, then return to the initial position.
During the entire movement:

en.title: Dumbbell Bench Press
en.lead: Exercise for chest, triceps and front deltoids
firstPosition: Lying on the bench, your feet flat on the floor, one dumbbell in each hand, pronation grip. Hold the dumbbells at your sides at chest height. Your forearms should be perpendicular to the ground.
By contracting your pectorals, push the load against upwards until your arms are almost extended, then return to the initial position.
During the entire movement:

es.title: Aperturas con mancuernas
es.lead: Exercise for chest and front deltoids
firstPosition: Lying on the bench, your feet flat on the floor, one dumbbell in each hand. Hold the weights in a neutral grip, arms outstretched above your chest.

Slowly lower the dumbbells to the sides in an arc with your arms until you feel a stretch in your pectorals. Do not go below shoulder level. Then return to the original position, performing the same arc.
During the whole movement:

en.title: Dumbbell Fly
en.lead: Exercise for chest and front deltoids
firstPosition: Lying on the bench, your feet flat on the floor, one dumbbell in each hand. Hold the weights in a neutral grip, arms outstretched above your chest.

Slowly lower the dumbbells to the sides in an arc with your arms until you feel a stretch in your pectorals. Do not go below shoulder level. Then return to the original position, performing the same arc.
During the whole movement:

es.title: Aperturas inclinadas con mancuernas
es.lead: Exercise for chest and front deltoids
firstPosition: Lying on the sloping bench, your feet flat on the floor, one dumbbell in each hand. Hold the weights in a neutral grip with your arms outstretched above your chest.
Slowly lower the dumbbells to the sides in an arc with your arms until you feel a stretch in your pectorals. Do not go below shoulder level. Then return to the original position, making the same arc.
During the whole movement:

en.title: Incline Dumbbell Fly
en.lead: Exercise for chest and front deltoids
firstPosition: Lying on the sloping bench, your feet flat on the floor, one dumbbell in each hand. Hold the weights in a neutral grip with your arms outstretched above your chest.
Slowly lower the dumbbells to the sides in an arc with your arms until you feel a stretch in your pectorals. Do not go below shoulder level. Then return to the original position, making the same arc.
During the whole movement:

es.title: Press de banca en máquina sentado
es.lead: Exercise for chest, triceps and shoulders
firstPosition: Set the chest press machine up so that when sitting down the handles are in line with the lower part of your chest. Make sure that you are sitting right back up against the seat. Grab hold of a handle in each hand, push your chest out, keep your head against the headrest.

Take a deep breath, and slowly push the handles forward until your arms are almost completely extended. Pause just before lockout, and then slowly return the handles back to the start position. Pausing just before the handles stop completely and repeating for another rep.

en.title: Chest Press Machine
en.lead: Exercise for chest, triceps and shoulders
firstPosition: Set the chest press machine up so that when sitting down the handles are in line with the lower part of your chest. Make sure that you are sitting right back up against the seat. Grab hold of a handle in each hand, push your chest out, keep your head against the headrest.

Take a deep breath, and slowly push the handles forward until your arms are almost completely extended. Pause just before lockout, and then slowly return the handles back to the start position. Pausing just before the handles stop completely and repeating for another rep.

es.title: Press de banca declinado con barra
es.lead: Exercise for lower chest, triceps and anterior deltoids
firstPosition: Lying on the declined bench, with your legs pressed against the pads. Holding the barbell with a grip wider than the width of your shoulders, with your hands in pronation. Your forearms should be perpendicular to the ground.
Release the barbell and slowly lower it to the lower part of your pectorals. While contracting your chest muscles, push the weighted barbell upwards until your arms are almost stretched out.
During the whole movement:

en.title: Barbell Declined Bench Press
en.lead: Exercise for lower chest, triceps and anterior deltoids
firstPosition: Lying on the declined bench, with your legs pressed against the pads. Holding the barbell with a grip wider than the width of your shoulders, with your hands in pronation. Your forearms should be perpendicular to the ground.
Release the barbell and slowly lower it to the lower part of your pectorals. While contracting your chest muscles, push the weighted barbell upwards until your arms are almost stretched out.
During the whole movement:

es.title: Press de banca declinado con mancuernas
es.lead: Exercise for lower chest, triceps and anterior deltoids
firstPosition: Lying on the declined bench, one dumbbell in each hand, pronation grip. Hold the dumbbells on the sides at chest height, elbows on the outside. Your forearms should be perpendicular to the ground.
While contracting your pectorals, push the dumbbells upwards until your arms are almost stretched out, and then go back to the starting position.
During the whole movement:

en.title: Dumbbell Declined Bench Press
en.lead: Exercise for lower chest, triceps and anterior deltoids
firstPosition: Lying on the declined bench, one dumbbell in each hand, pronation grip. Hold the dumbbells on the sides at chest height, elbows on the outside. Your forearms should be perpendicular to the ground.
While contracting your pectorals, push the dumbbells upwards until your arms are almost stretched out, and then go back to the starting position.
During the whole movement:

es.title: Flexiones
es.lead: Exercise for chest, triceps, deltoids and biceps
firstPosition: Face down, arms outstretched, hands wide apart, resting on the floor and aligned with your pectoral muscles. Legs stretched and face pointed towards the ground.
Slowly bend your arms, letting your chest come closer to the ground, until your elbows form a 90 degrees angle. Then return to the starting position by pushing on your hands.

en.title: Push Ups
en.lead: Exercise for chest, triceps, deltoids and biceps
firstPosition: Face down, arms outstretched, hands wide apart, resting on the floor and aligned with your pectoral muscles. Legs stretched and face pointed towards the ground.
Slowly bend your arms, letting your chest come closer to the ground, until your elbows form a 90 degrees angle. Then return to the starting position by pushing on your hands.

es.title: Remo con mancuerna a una mano
es.lead: Exercise for back, hind deltoids and biceps
firstPosition: Place your left knee and left hand on the bench with your chest parallel to the floor. Keep your right foot on the ground and grasp the dumbbell still on the ground in your right hand in a neutral grip.

Keeping your arm close to your body, lift the dumbbell as high as possible by raising your elbow and keeping your forearm perpendicular to the ground. Once your series is over, do the same with the other arm.

en.title: Dumbbell Bent Over Row (Single Arm)
en.lead: Exercise for back, hind deltoids and biceps
firstPosition: Place your left knee and left hand on the bench with your chest parallel to the floor. Keep your right foot on the ground and grasp the dumbbell still on the ground in your right hand in a neutral grip.

Keeping your arm close to your body, lift the dumbbell as high as possible by raising your elbow and keeping your forearm perpendicular to the ground. Once your series is over, do the same with the other arm.

es.title: Jalón con agarre ancho
es.lead: Exercise for back and biceps
firstPosition: Sitting, thighs under the padded parts, the bar grasped in pronation, hands more apart than shoulder width. Keep elbows pointed outwards and back straight.
Pull the bar up to your chin. Keep the contraction for a moment before slowly returning to the initial position. During the movement, do not let your elbows come forward.

en.title: Wide Grip Pulldown
en.lead: Exercise for back and biceps
firstPosition: Sitting, thighs under the padded parts, the bar grasped in pronation, hands more apart than shoulder width. Keep elbows pointed outwards and back straight.
Pull the bar up to your chin. Keep the contraction for a moment before slowly returning to the initial position. During the movement, do not let your elbows come forward.

es.title: Remo en máquina
es.lead: Exercise for back, hind deltoids and biceps
firstPosition: Sitting on the machine's bench with your feet on the wedge. Grasp the double handle attached to the cable with both hands. Keep back straight and knees slightly bent.
Pull the load towards your abdomen. Tighten your back at the end of the movement by bringing your elbows as far back as possible. Then slowly return to the initial position.

en.title: Seated Cable Row
en.lead: Exercise for back, hind deltoids and biceps
firstPosition: Sitting on the machine's bench with your feet on the wedge. Grasp the double handle attached to the cable with both hands. Keep back straight and knees slightly bent.
Pull the load towards your abdomen. Tighten your back at the end of the movement by bringing your elbows as far back as possible. Then slowly return to the initial position.

es.title: Jalón al pecho con agarre cerrado
es.lead: Exercise for back and biceps
firstPosition: Seated, thighs under the padded parts, the double handle grasped with both hands. Keep your back straight.
Pull the load up to your upper chest without moving your elbows away from your body. Keep the contraction for a moment before slowly returning to the initial position.

en.title: Close Grip Pulldown
en.lead: Exercise for back and biceps
firstPosition: Seated, thighs under the padded parts, the double handle grasped with both hands. Keep your back straight.
Pull the load up to your upper chest without moving your elbows away from your body. Keep the contraction for a moment before slowly returning to the initial position.

es.title: Remo con barra
es.lead: Exercise for back, hind deltoids and biceps
firstPosition: Standing with slightly bent knees, grasping the bar with hands in pronation, grip wider than shoulder width. Bust bent forward, keep the back straight, the chest rounded.
Pull the load towards your abdomen. Tighten your back at the end of the movement, shoulders and elbows back. Then slowly return to the initial position.

en.title: Barbell Row
en.lead: Exercise for back, hind deltoids and biceps
firstPosition: Standing with slightly bent knees, grasping the bar with hands in pronation, grip wider than shoulder width. Bust bent forward, keep the back straight, the chest rounded.
Pull the load towards your abdomen. Tighten your back at the end of the movement, shoulders and elbows back. Then slowly return to the initial position.

es.title: Jalón tras nuca
es.lead: Exercise for back and biceps
firstPosition: Sitting, thighs under the padded parts, the bar grasped in pronation, hands more apart than shoulder width. Keep elbows pointed outwards and back straight.
Pull the bar at the back of the neck. Keep the contraction for a moment before slowly returning to the initial position. During the movement, do not let your elbows come forward.

en.title: Behind Neck Pulldown
en.lead: Exercise for back and biceps
firstPosition: Sitting, thighs under the padded parts, the bar grasped in pronation, hands more apart than shoulder width. Keep elbows pointed outwards and back straight.
Pull the bar at the back of the neck. Keep the contraction for a moment before slowly returning to the initial position. During the movement, do not let your elbows come forward.

es.title: Jalón al pecho con agarre invertido
es.lead: Exercise for back and biceps
firstPosition: Seated, thighs under the padded parts, bar grasped in supination, hands shoulder-width apart. Keep your back straight.
Pull the bar up to your upper chest. Keep the contraction for a moment, the shoulders well back before slowly returning to the initial position.

en.title: Reverse Grip Pulldown
en.lead: Exercise for back and biceps
firstPosition: Seated, thighs under the padded parts, bar grasped in supination, hands shoulder-width apart. Keep your back straight.
Pull the bar up to your upper chest. Keep the contraction for a moment, the shoulders well back before slowly returning to the initial position.

es.title: Jalón en polea con cuerda
es.lead: Exercise for back and triceps
firstPosition: Standing facing the high pulley, knees slightly bent and bust slightly bent forward. Grasp one end of the rope in each hand in a neutral grip.

Pull the rope up to your hips, letting your arms describe an arc of a circle. Keep your elbows slightly bent and close to your body. At the end of the movement, contract your back by squeezing your shoulders back, then return to the initial position.

en.title: Rope Pulldown
en.lead: Exercise for back and triceps
firstPosition: Standing facing the high pulley, knees slightly bent and bust slightly bent forward. Grasp one end of the rope in each hand in a neutral grip.

Pull the rope up to your hips, letting your arms describe an arc of a circle. Keep your elbows slightly bent and close to your body. At the end of the movement, contract your back by squeezing your shoulders back, then return to the initial position.

es.title: Remo en barra T
es.lead: Exercise for back, shoulders and biceps
firstPosition: Use a T-Bar machine (or place a barbell in the corner of a room). Stand with feet either side of the bar, bend your knees, and bow forward so that your chest is directly over the plate on the barbell. Grab the handle in both hands.
Keeping your posture still, pull the handles so that the plate rises towards your chest. Pause just before it touches, and then slowly lower it back down.

en.title: T-Bar Rows
en.lead: Exercise for back, shoulders and biceps
firstPosition: Use a T-Bar machine (or place a barbell in the corner of a room). Stand with feet either side of the bar, bend your knees, and bow forward so that your chest is directly over the plate on the barbell. Grab the handle in both hands.
Keeping your posture still, pull the handles so that the plate rises towards your chest. Pause just before it touches, and then slowly lower it back down.

es.title: Remo inclinado con barra con agarre supinado
es.lead: Exercise for back and hind deltoids
firstPosition: Standing, your knees slightly bent. Grasp the bar with an underhand grip (supinated) with your hands at about shoulders width apart. Lean forward while keeping your back straight and your chest bulged.

Pull the bar towards your belly button. Squeeze your back at the top of the movement, driving your shoulders and elbows behind the body. Then, slowly come back to the starting position. Keep your elbows tucked in throughout the movement.

en.title: Barbell Bent Over Rows Supinated Grip
en.lead: Exercise for back and hind deltoids
firstPosition: Standing, your knees slightly bent. Grasp the bar with an underhand grip (supinated) with your hands at about shoulders width apart. Lean forward while keeping your back straight and your chest bulged.

Pull the bar towards your belly button. Squeeze your back at the top of the movement, driving your shoulders and elbows behind the body. Then, slowly come back to the starting position. Keep your elbows tucked in throughout the movement.

es.title: Elevaciones en barra fija
es.lead: Exercise for back and biceps
firstPosition: Grasp the pull bar using a pronated grip, head slightly up, hands wider than shoulders width apart, and elbows slightly bent.

Do a pull up by pulling your chin towards the bar. Then come back slowly to the starting position. Your segments’ length, your strength, and your shoulders’ mobility will determine how high you can pull yourself up.

en.title: Pull Up
en.lead: Exercise for back and biceps
firstPosition: Grasp the pull bar using a pronated grip, head slightly up, hands wider than shoulders width apart, and elbows slightly bent.

Do a pull up by pulling your chin towards the bar. Then come back slowly to the starting position. Your segments’ length, your strength, and your shoulders’ mobility will determine how high you can pull yourself up.

es.title: Elevaciones tras nuca en barra fija
es.lead: Exercise for back and biceps
firstPosition: Grasp the pull bar using a pronated grip, head slightly up, hands wider than shoulders width apart, and elbows slightly bent.

Do a pull up by pulling your head in front of the bar. Then come back slowly to the starting position. Your segments’ length, your strength, and your shoulders’ mobility will determine how high you can pull yourself up.

en.title: Behind the Neck Pull Up
en.lead: Exercise for back and biceps
firstPosition: Grasp the pull bar using a pronated grip, head slightly up, hands wider than shoulders width apart, and elbows slightly bent.

Do a pull up by pulling your head in front of the bar. Then come back slowly to the starting position. Your segments’ length, your strength, and your shoulders’ mobility will determine how high you can pull yourself up.

es.title: Elevaciones en barra fija con agarre supinado
es.lead: Exercise for back and biceps
firstPosition: Grasp the pull bar using an underhand (supinated) grip, head slightly up, hands about shoulders-width apart, elbows slightly bent and pointing forward.

Do a pull up by pulling your chin towards the bar. Then come back slowly to the starting position. Your segments’ length, your strength, and your shoulders’ mobility will determine how high you can pull yourself up.

en.title: Pull Up with a Supinated Grip
en.lead: Exercise for back and biceps
firstPosition: Grasp the pull bar using an underhand (supinated) grip, head slightly up, hands about shoulders-width apart, elbows slightly bent and pointing forward.

Do a pull up by pulling your chin towards the bar. Then come back slowly to the starting position. Your segments’ length, your strength, and your shoulders’ mobility will determine how high you can pull yourself up.

es.title: Jalón dorsal con brazos rectos
es.lead: Exercise for back and triceps
firstPosition: Standing, facing the high pulley cable machine, with your knees slightly bent, your torso bending over, back straight and your chest bulged. Grasp the bar with an overhand (pronated, palms facing down) grip with the elbow slightly bent.
Pull the bar towards your hips while making an arc. Contract your lats by squeezing together your shoulder blades, and then slowly come back to the starting position.

en.title: Straight Arm Lat Pulldown
en.lead: Exercise for back and triceps
firstPosition: Standing, facing the high pulley cable machine, with your knees slightly bent, your torso bending over, back straight and your chest bulged. Grasp the bar with an overhand (pronated, palms facing down) grip with the elbow slightly bent.
Pull the bar towards your hips while making an arc. Contract your lats by squeezing together your shoulder blades, and then slowly come back to the starting position.

es.title: Remo inclinado con mancuernas
es.lead: Exercise for back, biceps and hind deltoids
firstPosition: Standing, your knees slightly bent. Grasp the dumbbells with a neutral grip (palms facing each other). Lean forward while keeping your back straight and your chest bulged.

Pull the dumbbells towards your hips. Squeeze your back at the top of the movement, driving your shoulders and elbows behind the body. Then, slowly come back to the starting position. Keep your elbows tucked in throughout the movement.

en.title: Dumbbell Bent Over Rows
en.lead: Exercise for back, biceps and hind deltoids
firstPosition: Standing, your knees slightly bent. Grasp the dumbbells with a neutral grip (palms facing each other). Lean forward while keeping your back straight and your chest bulged.

Pull the dumbbells towards your hips. Squeeze your back at the top of the movement, driving your shoulders and elbows behind the body. Then, slowly come back to the starting position. Keep your elbows tucked in throughout the movement.

es.title: Pullover con mancuerna
es.lead: Exercise for back, chest and triceps
firstPosition: Upper back resting crossways on the bench (see illustration). Feet on the ground, shoulder width apart, pelvis slightly lower than the height of the bench. Hold the dumbbell with both hands above your chest, with your arms almost fully extended.
While keeping your elbows slightly bent, slowly lower the dumbbell behind your head in an arc. When your arms reach your head level, slowly go back to the starting position.

en.title: Dumbbell Pullover
en.lead: Exercise for back, chest and triceps
firstPosition: Upper back resting crossways on the bench (see illustration). Feet on the ground, shoulder width apart, pelvis slightly lower than the height of the bench. Hold the dumbbell with both hands above your chest, with your arms almost fully extended.
While keeping your elbows slightly bent, slowly lower the dumbbell behind your head in an arc. When your arms reach your head level, slowly go back to the starting position.

es.title: Pullover con barra
es.lead: Exercise for back, chest and triceps
firstPosition: Lying on a bench, feet on the ground at shoulder width apart. Hold the barbell with your hands in pronation above your chest, arms almost fully extended.
With your elbows slightly bent, slowly lower the barbell behind your head in an arc. Once your arms are at your head level, slowly go back to the starting position.

en.title: Barbell Pullover
en.lead: Exercise for back, chest and triceps
firstPosition: Lying on a bench, feet on the ground at shoulder width apart. Hold the barbell with your hands in pronation above your chest, arms almost fully extended.
With your elbows slightly bent, slowly lower the barbell behind your head in an arc. Once your arms are at your head level, slowly go back to the starting position.

es.title: Peso muerto con barra
es.lead: Exercise mainly for back, legs and the whole body
firstPosition: Barbell placed on the ground in front of you. Feet a little less than shoulder width apart with your knees bent. With your arms fully extended, grab the barbell in pronation, hands shoulder-width apart Keep your torso slightly bent forward, back straight, shoulders pulled back and chest out. Inhale and tighten your abdominal muscles.

While keeping your arms straight, lift the barbell by extending your legs and straightening your torso to reach a vertical position. Exhale at the end of the motion. Then slowly go back to the starting position. Always remember never to bend your back.

en.title: Barbell Deadlift
en.lead: Exercise mainly for back, legs and the whole body
firstPosition: Barbell placed on the ground in front of you. Feet a little less than shoulder width apart with your knees bent. With your arms fully extended, grab the barbell in pronation, hands shoulder-width apart Keep your torso slightly bent forward, back straight, shoulders pulled back and chest out. Inhale and tighten your abdominal muscles.

While keeping your arms straight, lift the barbell by extending your legs and straightening your torso to reach a vertical position. Exhale at the end of the motion. Then slowly go back to the starting position. Always remember never to bend your back.

es.title: Peso muerto sumo con barra
es.lead: Exercise mainly for back, legs and the whole body
firstPosition: Barbell placed on the ground in front of you. Legs apart and feet in an outward pointing position while remaining aligned with your knees. Legs bent, thighs almost horizontal (depending on your morphology). Barbell grip in pronation, with hands shoulder-width apart. Torso slightly bent forward, back straight, shoulders pulled back and chest out. Inhale and tighten your abdominal muscles.

While keeping your arms straight, lift the barbell by extending your legs and straightening your torso to reach a vertical position. Exhale at the end of the motion. Then slowly go back to the starting position. Always remember never to bend your back.

en.title: Barbell Sumo Deadlift
en.lead: Exercise mainly for back, legs and the whole body
firstPosition: Barbell placed on the ground in front of you. Legs apart and feet in an outward pointing position while remaining aligned with your knees. Legs bent, thighs almost horizontal (depending on your morphology). Barbell grip in pronation, with hands shoulder-width apart. Torso slightly bent forward, back straight, shoulders pulled back and chest out. Inhale and tighten your abdominal muscles.

While keeping your arms straight, lift the barbell by extending your legs and straightening your torso to reach a vertical position. Exhale at the end of the motion. Then slowly go back to the starting position. Always remember never to bend your back.

es.title: Peso muerto con barra hexagonal
es.lead: Exercise mainly for back, legs and the whole body
firstPosition: Standing inside the trap barbell, with your feet a little less than shoulder width apart, and your knees bent. Grab the trap barbell handles. Torso slightly bent forward, back straight, shoulders pulled back and chest out. Inhale and tighten your abdominal muscles.

While keeping your arms straight, lift the barbell by extending your legs and straightening your torso to reach a vertical position. Exhale at the end of the motion. Then slowly go back to the starting position. Always remember never to bend your back.

en.title: Trap Bar Deadlift
en.lead: Exercise mainly for back, legs and the whole body
firstPosition: Standing inside the trap barbell, with your feet a little less than shoulder width apart, and your knees bent. Grab the trap barbell handles. Torso slightly bent forward, back straight, shoulders pulled back and chest out. Inhale and tighten your abdominal muscles.

While keeping your arms straight, lift the barbell by extending your legs and straightening your torso to reach a vertical position. Exhale at the end of the motion. Then slowly go back to the starting position. Always remember never to bend your back.

es.title: Peso muerto con mancuernas
es.lead: Exercise mainly for back, legs and the whole body
firstPosition: Dumbbells on the ground on both sides of you. Your feet a little less than shoulder width apart, knees bent. Grab the dumbbells in a neutral grip. Torso slightly bent forward, back straight, shoulders pulled back and chest out. Inhale and tighten your abdominal muscles.

While keeping your arms outstretched, lift the dumbbells by extending your legs and straightening your torso to reach a vertical position. Exhale at the end of the motion. Then, slowly go back to the starting position. Always remember never to bend your back.

en.title: Dumbbell Deadlift
en.lead: Exercise mainly for back, legs and the whole body
firstPosition: Dumbbells on the ground on both sides of you. Your feet a little less than shoulder width apart, knees bent. Grab the dumbbells in a neutral grip. Torso slightly bent forward, back straight, shoulders pulled back and chest out. Inhale and tighten your abdominal muscles.

While keeping your arms outstretched, lift the dumbbells by extending your legs and straightening your torso to reach a vertical position. Exhale at the end of the motion. Then, slowly go back to the starting position. Always remember never to bend your back.

es.title: Encogimiento de hombros con barra
es.lead: Exercise for back
firstPosition: Standing, holding the bar in front of you, pronation grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Keeping your arms outstretched, raise your shoulders as high as possible. Contract your trapezius muscles at the top of the movement, then slowly return to the initial position.

en.title: Barbell Shrug
en.lead: Exercise for back
firstPosition: Standing, holding the bar in front of you, pronation grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Keeping your arms outstretched, raise your shoulders as high as possible. Contract your trapezius muscles at the top of the movement, then slowly return to the initial position.

es.title: Encogimiento de hombros con mancuernas
es.lead: Exercise for trapezius muscles
firstPosition: Standing, arms stretched out along the body, one dumbbell in each hand.
Keeping your arms outstretched, raise your shoulders as high as possible. Contract your trapezius muscles at the top of the movement, then slowly return to the initial position.

en.title: Dumbbell Shrugs
en.lead: Exercise for trapezius muscles
firstPosition: Standing, arms stretched out along the body, one dumbbell in each hand.
Keeping your arms outstretched, raise your shoulders as high as possible. Contract your trapezius muscles at the top of the movement, then slowly return to the initial position.

es.title: Press de hombro con mancuernas
es.lead: Exercise for shoulders and triceps
firstPosition: Sitting on a bench with your back well supported against the backrest. Hold the dumbbells in your hands (pronation grip) a little above shoulder height. Your elbows are on the outside and your forearms are perpendicular to the ground.
Push the dumbbells upwards. Until your arms are fully extended. Then return to the original position.

en.title: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
en.lead: Exercise for shoulders and triceps
firstPosition: Sitting on a bench with your back well supported against the backrest. Hold the dumbbells in your hands (pronation grip) a little above shoulder height. Your elbows are on the outside and your forearms are perpendicular to the ground.
Push the dumbbells upwards. Until your arms are fully extended. Then return to the original position.

es.title: Elevación lateral con mancuernas
es.lead: Exercise Execution Guide for Strong Shoulders & Trapezius Muscles
firstPosition: Standing with feet about shoulder width apart, arms along the body and a dumbbell in each hand
Slowly raise the arms sideways to the horizontal, keeping the elbows slightly bent. Contract your deltoids for a moment in the high position, then slowly return to the initial position.

en.title: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
en.lead: Exercise Execution Guide for Strong Shoulders & Trapezius Muscles
firstPosition: Standing with feet about shoulder width apart, arms along the body and a dumbbell in each hand
Slowly raise the arms sideways to the horizontal, keeping the elbows slightly bent. Contract your deltoids for a moment in the high position, then slowly return to the initial position.

es.title: Elevación frontal con mancuernas
es.lead: Exercise for shoulders
firstPosition: Standing with feet about shoulder width apart, one dumbbell in each hand (pronation grip).
Slowly raise the arms forward until they are parallel to the ground. Contract your deltoids for a moment in the raised position, then slowly return to the initial position.

en.title: Dumbbell Front Raise
en.lead: Exercise for shoulders
firstPosition: Standing with feet about shoulder width apart, one dumbbell in each hand (pronation grip).
Slowly raise the arms forward until they are parallel to the ground. Contract your deltoids for a moment in the raised position, then slowly return to the initial position.

es.title: Cruces inversos en polea alta
es.lead: Exercise for shoulders and back
firstPosition: Standing between the pulleys with the right handle in the left hand and the left handle in the right hand. Your arms folded in front of you at shoulder height.

Tightening your posterior deltoids and keeping your arms almost straight, pull your elbows as far back as possible in an arc. Stay in this position for a moment before returning to the initial position.

en.title: High Cable Rear Delt Fly
en.lead: Exercise for shoulders and back
firstPosition: Standing between the pulleys with the right handle in the left hand and the left handle in the right hand. Your arms folded in front of you at shoulder height.

Tightening your posterior deltoids and keeping your arms almost straight, pull your elbows as far back as possible in an arc. Stay in this position for a moment before returning to the initial position.

es.title: Press de hombros en máquina Smith
es.lead: Exercise for shoulders and triceps
firstPosition: Sitting on a bench with your back well supported against the backrest. Position the bench so that the bar drops just in front of your face. Grasp the bar with your hands in pronation. Your back is well supported against the backrest, your elbows are on the outside and your forearms are perpendicular to the ground.

Unhook the bar and slowly bring it to the height of your chin. Contract your shoulders by pushing the load upwards. Stop the movement just before your arms are fully extended. Then return to the down position.

en.title: Smith Machine Shoulder Press
en.lead: Exercise for shoulders and triceps
firstPosition: Sitting on a bench with your back well supported against the backrest. Position the bench so that the bar drops just in front of your face. Grasp the bar with your hands in pronation. Your back is well supported against the backrest, your elbows are on the outside and your forearms are perpendicular to the ground.

Unhook the bar and slowly bring it to the height of your chin. Contract your shoulders by pushing the load upwards. Stop the movement just before your arms are fully extended. Then return to the down position.

es.title: Remo alto con barra
es.lead: Exercise for shoulders, back and biceps
firstPosition: Standing, holding the bar in front of you, pronation grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Lift the bar vertically to chest height. Contract for a moment, then return to the starting position. During the whole movement, keep the bar close to the body and the elbows higher than the wrists.

en.title: Barbell Upright Row
en.lead: Exercise for shoulders, back and biceps
firstPosition: Standing, holding the bar in front of you, pronation grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Lift the bar vertically to chest height. Contract for a moment, then return to the starting position. During the whole movement, keep the bar close to the body and the elbows higher than the wrists.

es.title: Elevaciones posteriores para hombros "pájaro"
es.lead: Exercise for shoulders and trapezius muscles
firstPosition: Standing with knees slightly bent, bust bent forward, almost parallel to the ground, keeping your back straight and your head in line with your spine. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other.
Slowly lift and move the dumbbells away from each side of your body in an arc with your arms. Contract for a moment in the raised position before returning to the initial position.

en.title: Bent-Over Lateral Raise
en.lead: Exercise for shoulders and trapezius muscles
firstPosition: Standing with knees slightly bent, bust bent forward, almost parallel to the ground, keeping your back straight and your head in line with your spine. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other.
Slowly lift and move the dumbbells away from each side of your body in an arc with your arms. Contract for a moment in the raised position before returning to the initial position.

es.title: Elevación lateral con cable a una mano
es.lead: Exercise for shoulders
firstPosition: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, your left side close to the pulley. The handle in your right hand, against the front of your thigh.
Slowly raise your arm to the side in an arc to the horizontal. Keep your elbow slightly bent. Stay in the raised position for a moment and then slowly return to the original position.

en.title: Cable One-Arm Lateral Raise
en.lead: Exercise for shoulders
firstPosition: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, your left side close to the pulley. The handle in your right hand, against the front of your thigh.
Slowly raise your arm to the side in an arc to the horizontal. Keep your elbow slightly bent. Stay in the raised position for a moment and then slowly return to the original position.

es.title: Press Militar con mancuernas
es.lead: Exercise for shoulders and triceps
firstPosition: Stand upright with a dumbbell resting on each shoulder and elbows pointed out in front of you. Feet should be shoulder width apart.
Bend knees slightly and then drive upwards, pushing the dumbbells straight up in the air and finishing with arms extended above your head. Pause, and then return to starting position.

en.title: Dumbbell Push Press
en.lead: Exercise for shoulders and triceps
firstPosition: Stand upright with a dumbbell resting on each shoulder and elbows pointed out in front of you. Feet should be shoulder width apart.
Bend knees slightly and then drive upwards, pushing the dumbbells straight up in the air and finishing with arms extended above your head. Pause, and then return to starting position.

es.title: Press Militar
es.lead: Exercise for shoulders and triceps
firstPosition: Stand upright with a barbell resting on your upper chest and shoulders and elbows pointed out in front of you. Feet should be shoulder width apart.
Bend knees slightly and then drive upwards, pushing the barbell straight up in the air and finishing with arms extended above your head. Pause, and then return to starting position.

en.title: Barbell Push Press
en.lead: Exercise for shoulders and triceps
firstPosition: Stand upright with a barbell resting on your upper chest and shoulders and elbows pointed out in front of you. Feet should be shoulder width apart.
Bend knees slightly and then drive upwards, pushing the barbell straight up in the air and finishing with arms extended above your head. Pause, and then return to starting position.

es.title: Elevaciones frontales con cable a una mano
es.lead: Exercise for front deltoids
firstPosition: Standing, your back facing the cable machine, with your knees slightly bent. Grasp the handle with an overhand (pronated), your arm along your body with the elbow slightly bent.

While keeping your elbow slightly bent, slowly raise forward your arm while making an arc. Once the arm is parallel with the floor squeeze briefly your shoulders, and then slowly come back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

en.title: Single-Arm Cable Front Raise
en.lead: Exercise for front deltoids
firstPosition: Standing, your back facing the cable machine, with your knees slightly bent. Grasp the handle with an overhand (pronated), your arm along your body with the elbow slightly bent.

While keeping your elbow slightly bent, slowly raise forward your arm while making an arc. Once the arm is parallel with the floor squeeze briefly your shoulders, and then slowly come back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

es.title: Elevaciones frontales con barra
es.lead: Exercise for front deltoids
firstPosition: Standing, your feet about shoulders width apart, elbows slightly bent, arms along the body, grasp the handle with an overhand (pronated) grip, hands shoulders width apart.

Slowly raise your arms forward until they are parallel with the floor. Squeeze briefly your shoulders at the top and then slowly come back to the starting position. Keep your back straight throughout the movement.

en.title: Barbell Front Raise
en.lead: Exercise for front deltoids
firstPosition: Standing, your feet about shoulders width apart, elbows slightly bent, arms along the body, grasp the handle with an overhand (pronated) grip, hands shoulders width apart.

Slowly raise your arms forward until they are parallel with the floor. Squeeze briefly your shoulders at the top and then slowly come back to the starting position. Keep your back straight throughout the movement.

es.title: Press militar sentado con barra
es.lead: Exercise for shoulders and triceps
firstPosition: Sit down on the bench and unrack the bar using an overhand (pronated) grip, your elbows pointing outward. The bar stands in front of you at chin’s level. This level may vary depending on your shoulders’ flexibility. The gap between your hands should be such that your elbows are forming a 90° angle when your arms are parallel to the floor.
Squeeze your shoulders while pressing the weight vertically. Stop the movement when your arms are about to be fully outstretched. Then, come back slowly to the starting position.

en.title: Seated Barbell Shoulder Press
en.lead: Exercise for shoulders and triceps
firstPosition: Sit down on the bench and unrack the bar using an overhand (pronated) grip, your elbows pointing outward. The bar stands in front of you at chin’s level. This level may vary depending on your shoulders’ flexibility. The gap between your hands should be such that your elbows are forming a 90° angle when your arms are parallel to the floor.
Squeeze your shoulders while pressing the weight vertically. Stop the movement when your arms are about to be fully outstretched. Then, come back slowly to the starting position.

es.title: Press tras nuca sentado
es.lead: Exercise for shoulders and triceps
firstPosition: Sit down on the bench with your back straight and your chest bulged. Unrack the bar using an overhand (pronated) grip, your elbows pointing outward. The bar stands behind you at neck’s level. This level may vary depending on your shoulders’ flexibility. The gap between your hands should be such that your elbows are forming a 90° angle when your arms are parallel to the floor.
Squeeze your shoulders while pressing the weight vertically. Stop the movement when your arms are about to be fully outstretched. Then, come back slowly to the starting position.

en.title: Seated Behind the Neck Barbell Shoulder Press
en.lead: Exercise for shoulders and triceps
firstPosition: Sit down on the bench with your back straight and your chest bulged. Unrack the bar using an overhand (pronated) grip, your elbows pointing outward. The bar stands behind you at neck’s level. This level may vary depending on your shoulders’ flexibility. The gap between your hands should be such that your elbows are forming a 90° angle when your arms are parallel to the floor.
Squeeze your shoulders while pressing the weight vertically. Stop the movement when your arms are about to be fully outstretched. Then, come back slowly to the starting position.

es.title: Press militar de pie
es.lead: Exercise for shoulders and triceps
firstPosition: Standing with your back straight, chest bulged, feet about shoulders width apart, and knees slightly bent. Grasp the bar using a pronated grip, your elbows pointing outward. The bar stands at chin’s level. This level may vary depending on your shoulders’ flexibility. The gap between your hands should be such that your elbows are forming a 90° angle when your arms are parallel to the floor.
Squeeze your shoulders while pressing the weight vertically. Stop the movement when your arms are about to be fully outstretched. Then, come back slowly to the starting position.

en.title: Standing Barbell Shoulder Press
en.lead: Exercise for shoulders and triceps
firstPosition: Standing with your back straight, chest bulged, feet about shoulders width apart, and knees slightly bent. Grasp the bar using a pronated grip, your elbows pointing outward. The bar stands at chin’s level. This level may vary depending on your shoulders’ flexibility. The gap between your hands should be such that your elbows are forming a 90° angle when your arms are parallel to the floor.
Squeeze your shoulders while pressing the weight vertically. Stop the movement when your arms are about to be fully outstretched. Then, come back slowly to the starting position.

es.title: Press militar de pie tras nuca
es.lead: Exercise for shoulders and triceps
firstPosition: Standing with your back straight, chest bulged, feet about shoulders width apart, and knees slightly bent. Grasp the bar using a pronated grip, your elbows pointing outward. The bar stands behind you at neck’s level. This level may vary depending on your shoulders’ flexibility. The gap between your hands should be such that your elbows are forming a 90° angle when your arms are parallel to the floor.
Squeeze your shoulders while pressing the weight vertically. Stop the movement when your arms are about to be fully outstretched. Then, come back slowly to the starting position.

en.title: Standing Behind the Neck Barbell Shoulder Press
en.lead: Exercise for shoulders and triceps
firstPosition: Standing with your back straight, chest bulged, feet about shoulders width apart, and knees slightly bent. Grasp the bar using a pronated grip, your elbows pointing outward. The bar stands behind you at neck’s level. This level may vary depending on your shoulders’ flexibility. The gap between your hands should be such that your elbows are forming a 90° angle when your arms are parallel to the floor.
Squeeze your shoulders while pressing the weight vertically. Stop the movement when your arms are about to be fully outstretched. Then, come back slowly to the starting position.

es.title: Elevación frontal con mancuernas alternas agarre neutro
es.lead: Exercise for shoulders
firstPosition: Standing, arms along the body, elbows slightly bent, one dumbbell in each hand, neutral grip.

Slowly lift one arm forward in an arc until it is parallel to the ground. Squeeze your anterior deltoid for a moment, and then slowly go back to the starting position. Do the same with the other arm. Keep your back straight during the exercise.

en.title: Alternate Dumbbell Front Raise Neutral Grip
en.lead: Exercise for shoulders
firstPosition: Standing, arms along the body, elbows slightly bent, one dumbbell in each hand, neutral grip.

Slowly lift one arm forward in an arc until it is parallel to the ground. Squeeze your anterior deltoid for a moment, and then slowly go back to the starting position. Do the same with the other arm. Keep your back straight during the exercise.

es.title: Elevación frontal con un brazo en polea baja agarre neutro
es.lead: Exercise for shoulders
firstPosition: Standing with back turned to the pulley. Holding the end of the rope, hand in neutral grip, arms along your body, elbow slightly bent.

Keeping your elbow slightly bent, slowly lift your arm forward in an arc. Once your arm is parallel to the ground, squeeze your anterior deltoid for a moment and then go back to your starting position. Keep your back straight during the exercise.

en.title: One-Arm Low-Pulley Front Raise Neutral Grip
en.lead: Exercise for shoulders
firstPosition: Standing with back turned to the pulley. Holding the end of the rope, hand in neutral grip, arms along your body, elbow slightly bent.

Keeping your elbow slightly bent, slowly lift your arm forward in an arc. Once your arm is parallel to the ground, squeeze your anterior deltoid for a moment and then go back to your starting position. Keep your back straight during the exercise.

es.title: Elevación frontal con mancuerna a dos manos
es.lead: Exercise for shoulders
firstPosition: Standing with feet about shoulder width apart, elbows slightly bent, arms alongside the body, holding the dumbbell with both hands (as illustrated).

Slowly lift the arms forward in an arc until they are parallel to the ground. Squeeze your deltoids for a moment, and then slowly go back to your starting position. Keep your back straight during the exercise.

en.title: Two-Handed Dumbbell Front Raise
en.lead: Exercise for shoulders
firstPosition: Standing with feet about shoulder width apart, elbows slightly bent, arms alongside the body, holding the dumbbell with both hands (as illustrated).

Slowly lift the arms forward in an arc until they are parallel to the ground. Squeeze your deltoids for a moment, and then slowly go back to your starting position. Keep your back straight during the exercise.

es.title: Curl con barra
es.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Standing with knees slightly bent and back straight. Hold the bar with your hands in supination, about shoulder width apart.

Without making a bust movement, raise the bar by bending the forearms. Contract your biceps in the high position, then let the bar slowly come down to the initial position. Keep your elbows close to your body during the movement.

en.title: Barbell Curl
en.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Standing with knees slightly bent and back straight. Hold the bar with your hands in supination, about shoulder width apart.

Without making a bust movement, raise the bar by bending the forearms. Contract your biceps in the high position, then let the bar slowly come down to the initial position. Keep your elbows close to your body during the movement.

es.title: Curl alterno con mancuernas
es.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Standing with knees slightly bent and back straight. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, in a neutral grip along the body.

Without making a bust movement, raise a dumbbell by bending the forearm. During the movement, rotate your wrist outwards until your hand is supine in the upright position. Contract your biceps, then slowly return to the initial position. Keep your elbow close to your body during the movement. Alternate this movement one arm after the other.

en.title: Alternating Dumbbell Curl
en.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Standing with knees slightly bent and back straight. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, in a neutral grip along the body.

Without making a bust movement, raise a dumbbell by bending the forearm. During the movement, rotate your wrist outwards until your hand is supine in the upright position. Contract your biceps, then slowly return to the initial position. Keep your elbow close to your body during the movement. Alternate this movement one arm after the other.

es.title: Curl con cuerda en polea
es.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Standing in front of the pulley, knees slightly bent, grasp the rope with both hands, in neutral grip, arms relaxed along the body.

Without making a bust movement, bend your forearms, bringing your hands as close as possible to your shoulders, without bringing your elbows too far forward. Contract your biceps in a high position, then slowly return to the initial position.

en.title: Rope Cable Curl
en.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Standing in front of the pulley, knees slightly bent, grasp the rope with both hands, in neutral grip, arms relaxed along the body.

Without making a bust movement, bend your forearms, bringing your hands as close as possible to your shoulders, without bringing your elbows too far forward. Contract your biceps in a high position, then slowly return to the initial position.

es.title: Curl con barra EZ
es.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Standing with knees slightly bent and back straight. Hold the EZ bar with your hands in supination.

Without making a movement of bust, raise the EZ bar by bending the forearms. Contract your biceps in high position, then let the bar slowly come down again in the initial position. Keep your elbows close to your body during the movement.

en.title: EZ Barbell Curl
en.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Standing with knees slightly bent and back straight. Hold the EZ bar with your hands in supination.

Without making a movement of bust, raise the EZ bar by bending the forearms. Contract your biceps in high position, then let the bar slowly come down again in the initial position. Keep your elbows close to your body during the movement.

es.title: Curl de predicador con barra EZ
es.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Sitting or standing, adjust the "Larry Scott" armrest so that it is slightly below the level of your shoulders. Rest your upper arms on the armrest and grasp the EZ bar with your hands in supination.

Slowly bend your forearms towards your shoulders while keeping your upper arms pressed against the armrest. Contract your biceps in the up position, then slowly return to the initial position. Be careful not to fully extend your forearms in the lowered position to avoid putting too much strain on the elbow joint.

en.title: EZ Barbell Preacher Curl
en.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Sitting or standing, adjust the "Larry Scott" armrest so that it is slightly below the level of your shoulders. Rest your upper arms on the armrest and grasp the EZ bar with your hands in supination.

Slowly bend your forearms towards your shoulders while keeping your upper arms pressed against the armrest. Contract your biceps in the up position, then slowly return to the initial position. Be careful not to fully extend your forearms in the lowered position to avoid putting too much strain on the elbow joint.

es.title: Curl alterno de martillo con mancuernas
es.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Standing with knees slightly bent and back straight. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, in a neutral grip along the body.

Without making a bust movement, raise a dumbbell by bending the forearms. Keep your hand in a neutral grip (hence the name hammer grip). Contract your biceps, then slowly return to the initial position. Keep your elbow close to your body during the movement. Alternate this movement one arm after the other.

en.title: Hammer Curl
en.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Standing with knees slightly bent and back straight. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, in a neutral grip along the body.

Without making a bust movement, raise a dumbbell by bending the forearms. Keep your hand in a neutral grip (hence the name hammer grip). Contract your biceps, then slowly return to the initial position. Keep your elbow close to your body during the movement. Alternate this movement one arm after the other.

es.title: Curl inclinado con mancuernas
es.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Sitting on a bench with the backrest tilted at an angle of 40 to 60 degrees. Let your arms hang down towards the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand in supination.

Keeping your back well against the backrest, raise a dumbbell by bending your forearm towards your shoulder. Contract your biceps in the high position, then slowly return to the initial position. Keep your elbow close to your body during the movement. Alternate this movement one arm after the other.

en.title: Incline Dumbbell Curl
en.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Sitting on a bench with the backrest tilted at an angle of 40 to 60 degrees. Let your arms hang down towards the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand in supination.

Keeping your back well against the backrest, raise a dumbbell by bending your forearm towards your shoulder. Contract your biceps in the high position, then slowly return to the initial position. Keep your elbow close to your body during the movement. Alternate this movement one arm after the other.

es.title: Curl concentrado con mancuerna
es.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Sitting on a bench, hold a dumbbell in your right hand, supine grip. With your chest slightly bent forward, rest your elbow on the inside of your right thigh, leaving your arm relaxed towards the ground.

Slowly bend your forearm as you bring the dumbbell towards your right shoulder. Contract your biceps in the high position, then slowly return to the initial position. Once your series is completed, move to the other arm.

en.title: Dumbbell Concentration Curl
en.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Sitting on a bench, hold a dumbbell in your right hand, supine grip. With your chest slightly bent forward, rest your elbow on the inside of your right thigh, leaving your arm relaxed towards the ground.

Slowly bend your forearm as you bring the dumbbell towards your right shoulder. Contract your biceps in the high position, then slowly return to the initial position. Once your series is completed, move to the other arm.

es.title: Curl de cable en polea baja a una mano
es.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Stand in front of the cable machine and grasp the handle with an underhand (supinated) grip. The knees should be slightly bent and your arm relaxed along your body.

Keeping your torso fixed, elbow tucked in at your side, and eyes facing forward, slowly curl the weight up as far as possible without letting the elbow move forward excessively; only your forearm should be moving. Squeeze the biceps at the top of the movement, and then slowly lower the weight back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps and then repeat for the other arm.

en.title: Single-Arm Low Pulley Cable Curl
en.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Stand in front of the cable machine and grasp the handle with an underhand (supinated) grip. The knees should be slightly bent and your arm relaxed along your body.

Keeping your torso fixed, elbow tucked in at your side, and eyes facing forward, slowly curl the weight up as far as possible without letting the elbow move forward excessively; only your forearm should be moving. Squeeze the biceps at the top of the movement, and then slowly lower the weight back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps and then repeat for the other arm.

es.title: Curl de cable con barra recta en polea baja
es.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Stand in front of the cable machine, legs shoulder width apart, and grasp the straight bar with an underhand (supinated) grip and your hands about shoulder width apart.

Keeping your body fixed, elbow tucked in at your side, and eyes facing forward, slowly curl the weight up as far as possible without letting the elbow move forward excessively; only your forearms should be moving. Squeeze the biceps at the top of the movement, and then slowly lower the weight back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

en.title: Straight Bar Low Pulley Cable Curl
en.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: Stand in front of the cable machine, legs shoulder width apart, and grasp the straight bar with an underhand (supinated) grip and your hands about shoulder width apart.

Keeping your body fixed, elbow tucked in at your side, and eyes facing forward, slowly curl the weight up as far as possible without letting the elbow move forward excessively; only your forearms should be moving. Squeeze the biceps at the top of the movement, and then slowly lower the weight back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

es.title: Curl de cable en polea alta de pie
es.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: grasp each of the cables with an underhand grip (supinated, palms facing up) and stand in the center with your arms outstretched.

Keeping your upper arms and body fixed, curl simultaneously the handles in towards your head as far as possible. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, pause, and then slowly lower the weight back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

en.title: Standing High Pulley Cable Curl
en.lead: Exercise for biceps
firstPosition: grasp each of the cables with an underhand grip (supinated, palms facing up) and stand in the center with your arms outstretched.

Keeping your upper arms and body fixed, curl simultaneously the handles in towards your head as far as possible. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, pause, and then slowly lower the weight back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

es.title: Curl de muñeca con barra sentado
es.lead: Exercise for forearms
firstPosition: Grasp a barbell using an underhand grip (supinated, palms facing up) and sit down on the end of a flat bench. Rest the back of your forearms on the top of your thighs or on the end of the bench so that your wrists are just off the end of your knees or of the bench.

Without moving the forearms, slowly raise your hands up as far as possible squeezing the forearms muscles at the top of the movement. Pause, and then slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

en.title: Seated Barbell Wrist Curl
en.lead: Exercise for forearms
firstPosition: Grasp a barbell using an underhand grip (supinated, palms facing up) and sit down on the end of a flat bench. Rest the back of your forearms on the top of your thighs or on the end of the bench so that your wrists are just off the end of your knees or of the bench.

Without moving the forearms, slowly raise your hands up as far as possible squeezing the forearms muscles at the top of the movement. Pause, and then slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

es.title: Extensión de muñeca con barra sentado
es.lead: Exercise for forearms
firstPosition: Grasp a barbell using an overhand grip (pronated, palms facing down) and sit down on the end of a flat bench. Rest your forearms on the top of your thighs or on the end of the bench so that your wrists are just off the end of your knees or of the bench.

Without moving the forearms, slowly raise your hands up as far as possible squeezing the forearms muscles at the top of the movement. Pause, and then slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

en.title: Seated Barbell Wrist Extension
en.lead: Exercise for forearms
firstPosition: Grasp a barbell using an overhand grip (pronated, palms facing down) and sit down on the end of a flat bench. Rest your forearms on the top of your thighs or on the end of the bench so that your wrists are just off the end of your knees or of the bench.

Without moving the forearms, slowly raise your hands up as far as possible squeezing the forearms muscles at the top of the movement. Pause, and then slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

es.title: Curl de barra invertido
es.lead: Exercise for biceps and forearms
firstPosition: Stand in front of the cable machine, knees slightly bent and back straight, grasp the straight or EZ-bar with an overhand (pronated) grip and your hands about shoulder width apart.

Without moving the torso, slowly raise your forearms up as far as possible squeezing them at the top of the movement, pause, and then slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position. Keep the elbows tucked in throughout the movement. Repeat for desired reps.

en.title: Reverse Barbell Curl
en.lead: Exercise for biceps and forearms
firstPosition: Stand in front of the cable machine, knees slightly bent and back straight, grasp the straight or EZ-bar with an overhand (pronated) grip and your hands about shoulder width apart.

Without moving the torso, slowly raise your forearms up as far as possible squeezing them at the top of the movement, pause, and then slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position. Keep the elbows tucked in throughout the movement. Repeat for desired reps.

es.title: Extensión de tríceps tumbado
es.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Lying on the bench, your feet flat on the floor or on the bench. Hold the EZ bar above your chest, pronated grip, hands slightly tighter than shoulder width.
Slowly bend your forearms without spreading your elbows too far apart, bringing the bar to the top of your head. Then return to the initial position.

en.title: Lying Triceps Extension
en.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Lying on the bench, your feet flat on the floor or on the bench. Hold the EZ bar above your chest, pronated grip, hands slightly tighter than shoulder width.
Slowly bend your forearms without spreading your elbows too far apart, bringing the bar to the top of your head. Then return to the initial position.

es.title: Extensión de tríceps en polea
es.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Standing facing the pulley, grasping the bar with a pronation grip, hands shoulder width apart.

Carry out an extension of the forearms until your arms are fully extended. In this position, contract your triceps for a moment and then slowly return to the initial position. Keep your elbows close to your body during the whole movement.

en.title: Triceps Pressdown
en.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Standing facing the pulley, grasping the bar with a pronation grip, hands shoulder width apart.

Carry out an extension of the forearms until your arms are fully extended. In this position, contract your triceps for a moment and then slowly return to the initial position. Keep your elbows close to your body during the whole movement.

es.title: Extensión de tríceps en polea con cuerda
es.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Standing in front of the pulley, grasp one end of the rope in each hand in neutral grip.

Extend your forearms by spreading the ends of the rope slightly apart until your arms are fully extended. In this position, contract your triceps for a moment and then slowly return to the initial position. Keep your elbows close to your body during the whole movement.

en.title: Cable Rope Pushdown
en.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Standing in front of the pulley, grasp one end of the rope in each hand in neutral grip.

Extend your forearms by spreading the ends of the rope slightly apart until your arms are fully extended. In this position, contract your triceps for a moment and then slowly return to the initial position. Keep your elbows close to your body during the whole movement.

es.title: Extensión de tríceps con mancuernas por encima de la cabeza
es.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Sitting on a bench, back straight, grasping a dumbbell with both hands, palms against the inside of a disc (see picture). Position the dumbbell above your head, arms outstretched, triceps well contracted.
Lower your forearms behind your head until your elbows form a 90° angle. Then extend the forearms, returning to the initial position.

en.title: Dumbbell Overhead Triceps Extension
en.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Sitting on a bench, back straight, grasping a dumbbell with both hands, palms against the inside of a disc (see picture). Position the dumbbell above your head, arms outstretched, triceps well contracted.
Lower your forearms behind your head until your elbows form a 90° angle. Then extend the forearms, returning to the initial position.

es.title: Press banca con agarre cerrado
es.lead: Exercise for triceps, chest and anterior deltoids
firstPosition: Lying on the bench, your feet flat on the floor. Grasp the bar with a pronation grip, hands slightly tighter than shoulder width.
Unhook the bar and slowly lower it to the lower part of your chest. Then push the load upwards until your arms are straight.
During the whole movement:

en.title: Close Grip Bench Press
en.lead: Exercise for triceps, chest and anterior deltoids
firstPosition: Lying on the bench, your feet flat on the floor. Grasp the bar with a pronation grip, hands slightly tighter than shoulder width.
Unhook the bar and slowly lower it to the lower part of your chest. Then push the load upwards until your arms are straight.
During the whole movement:

es.title: Patadas traseras
es.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Place your left knee and left hand on a bench, with your chest parallel to the floor. Keep your right foot on the ground and grasp the dumbbell in your right hand. Keeping it close to your body, raise the top of your right arm until it is parallel to the ground.

Perform an extension of the right arm. When it is fully extended, contract your triceps for a moment before returning to the initial position. Once you have completed your series, do the same with the other arm.

en.title: Kickback
en.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Place your left knee and left hand on a bench, with your chest parallel to the floor. Keep your right foot on the ground and grasp the dumbbell in your right hand. Keeping it close to your body, raise the top of your right arm until it is parallel to the ground.

Perform an extension of the right arm. When it is fully extended, contract your triceps for a moment before returning to the initial position. Once you have completed your series, do the same with the other arm.

es.title: Extensión de tríceps con cable de agarre inverso con barra
es.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Stand in front of the cable machine and grasp the straight bar with an underhand (supinated, palms facing up) grip, hands about shoulders width apart, elbows tucked in and bent at a bit less than a 90° angle.

Extend the forearms until your arms are completely stretched. In this position, squeeze your triceps, pause, and then slowly come back to the starting position. Keep the elbows tucked in throughout the movement. Repeat for desired reps.

en.title: Reverse Grip Cable Triceps Extension with Barbell
en.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Stand in front of the cable machine and grasp the straight bar with an underhand (supinated, palms facing up) grip, hands about shoulders width apart, elbows tucked in and bent at a bit less than a 90° angle.

Extend the forearms until your arms are completely stretched. In this position, squeeze your triceps, pause, and then slowly come back to the starting position. Keep the elbows tucked in throughout the movement. Repeat for desired reps.

es.title: Extensión de tríceps con cable a una mano
es.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Stand in front of the cable machine and grasp the handle with an overhand (pronated, palm facing down) grip, elbows tucked in and bent at a bit less than a 90° angle.

Extend the forearms until your arm is completely stretched. In this position, squeeze your triceps, pause, and then slowly come back to the starting position. Keep the elbows tucked in throughout the movement. Repeat for desired reps and then repeat for the other arm.

en.title: Single-Arm Cable Triceps Extension
en.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Stand in front of the cable machine and grasp the handle with an overhand (pronated, palm facing down) grip, elbows tucked in and bent at a bit less than a 90° angle.

Extend the forearms until your arm is completely stretched. In this position, squeeze your triceps, pause, and then slowly come back to the starting position. Keep the elbows tucked in throughout the movement. Repeat for desired reps and then repeat for the other arm.

es.title: Extensión de tríceps con cable a una mano con agarre supinado
es.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Stand in front of the cable machine and grasp the handle with an underhand (supinated, palm facing up) grip, elbows tucked in and bent at a bit less than a 90° angle.

Extend the forearms until your arm is completely stretched. In this position, squeeze your triceps, pause, and then slowly come back to the starting position. Keep the elbows tucked in throughout the movement. Repeat for desired reps and then repeat for the other arm.

en.title: Single-Arm Cable Triceps Extension with Supinated Grip
en.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Stand in front of the cable machine and grasp the handle with an underhand (supinated, palm facing up) grip, elbows tucked in and bent at a bit less than a 90° angle.

Extend the forearms until your arm is completely stretched. In this position, squeeze your triceps, pause, and then slowly come back to the starting position. Keep the elbows tucked in throughout the movement. Repeat for desired reps and then repeat for the other arm.

es.title: Extensión de tríceps con mancuernas tumbado
es.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Lay back on the bench with your feet firmly on the ground or on the bench. Grab a dumbbell in each hand using a neutral grip (palms facing each other) with your arms extended above your chest.
Lower slowly your forearms, while keeping your elbows tucked in as much as possible, until they reach your forehead. Then slowly come back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

en.title: Lying Dumbbell Triceps Extension
en.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Lay back on the bench with your feet firmly on the ground or on the bench. Grab a dumbbell in each hand using a neutral grip (palms facing each other) with your arms extended above your chest.
Lower slowly your forearms, while keeping your elbows tucked in as much as possible, until they reach your forehead. Then slowly come back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

es.title: Press francés sentado con barra
es.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Sit on an upright bench, back firmly against the bench’s back rest, and grab a straight-bar or an EZ-bar with your hands slightly narrower than shoulders width apart. The bar or EZ-bar should be above your head with your arms outstretched and your triceps squeezed.

Lower slowly your forearms beyond your head until your elbows are at a 90° angle. Then slowly come back to the starting position and squeeze your triceps at the top. Keep your back straight throughout the movement. Repeat for desired reps.

en.title: Seated Barbell French Press
en.lead: Exercise for triceps
firstPosition: Sit on an upright bench, back firmly against the bench’s back rest, and grab a straight-bar or an EZ-bar with your hands slightly narrower than shoulders width apart. The bar or EZ-bar should be above your head with your arms outstretched and your triceps squeezed.

Lower slowly your forearms beyond your head until your elbows are at a 90° angle. Then slowly come back to the starting position and squeeze your triceps at the top. Keep your back straight throughout the movement. Repeat for desired reps.

es.title: Fondos en banco
es.lead: Exercise for triceps and front deltoids
firstPosition: Set up for the bench dip by placing two flat benches parallel to one another to around your legs’ length. Keeping your back straight and your arms outstretched, place your hands on the edge of one bench at about shoulder’s width and put your heels on the edge of the other bench, legs and buttocks swinging in the air (see picture).

While keeping your elbows tucked in, slowly flex them until they are at a 90° angle. Then slowly come back to the starting position and squeeze your triceps at the top. Keep your back straight throughout the movement. Repeat for desired reps.

en.title: Bench Dips
en.lead: Exercise for triceps and front deltoids
firstPosition: Set up for the bench dip by placing two flat benches parallel to one another to around your legs’ length. Keeping your back straight and your arms outstretched, place your hands on the edge of one bench at about shoulder’s width and put your heels on the edge of the other bench, legs and buttocks swinging in the air (see picture).

While keeping your elbows tucked in, slowly flex them until they are at a 90° angle. Then slowly come back to the starting position and squeeze your triceps at the top. Keep your back straight throughout the movement. Repeat for desired reps.

es.title: Fondos en barras paralelas
